data.enText: loved very much by sb; very popular with sb

data.chText: 受艺术家青睐的深紫色花
data.enText: the deep purple flowers so beloved by artists

data.chText: 为纪念我们的爱子——约翰
data.enText: in memory of our dearly beloved son, John
a person who is loved very much by sb

data.chText: 那是她心爱的人送的礼物。
data.enText: It was a gift from her beloved.

value.boxr_value: When the adjective is not followed by a noun it is pronounced /bɪ'lʌvd/ and is hyphenated be|loved. 该形容词后面没有接名词时读作/bɪ'lʌvd/，分音节形式为be|loved。

value.def: A beloved person, thing, or place is one that you feel great affection for.

example.ex: He lost his beloved wife last year...
The rose is the most romantic of flowers, beloved of poets, singers, and artists.
example.tran: 玫瑰是最浪漫的花，深受诗人、歌手和艺术家的喜爱。

gramarinfo.label: usu ADJ n, also v-link ADJ <l>of/by</l> n

value.def: Your beloved is the person that you love.

example.ex: He takes his beloved into his arms.
example.tran: 他将心爱之人拥入怀中。
